initial_prompt: drone with 400 meter range, rgb and thermal camerawith onboard object detection and a 15 min battery life

clarification_log.question: Total payload weight (camera module + companion computer)
Specific object detection requirements (e.g., detecting people, cars, animals)
Required video resolution for both RGB and Thermal sensors

final_constraints.fastening_method: M3 Hex Socket Cap Screws (Steel Alloy)
final_constraints.wiring_standard: 12-14 AWG Silicone Wire; XT60 Main Connector

engineering_plan.build_summary: This Engineering Brief outlines the development of an AI-enabled surveillance drone. The primary mission objective is the onboard, real-time detection of animals using a dual RGB/Thermal camera payload. A 7-inch 'Long Range' class quadcopter has been selected as the base topology to provide the necessary lift capacity and flight endurance to meet the 15-minute operational requirement. The platform will be powered by a 6S (22.2V) LiPo battery system and utilize a Digital HD video system for primary piloting and data transmission. Critical user input confirms an unconstrained budget, prioritizing capability. However, the final payload weight (camera module and companion computer) remains a critical undefined variable. Final selection of propulsion components (motors, ESCs, propellers) is contingent upon determining this weight to guarantee performance targets. The build will adhere to professional standards, including the use of M3 steel alloy fasteners, 12-14 AWG silicone wiring with an XT60 connector, and conformal coating on all critical electronics for enhanced environmental resistance.

failure.details: The build is impossible due to a critical component mismatch and missing information. The part listed as 'FC_Stack' is an analog video transmitter (TS5823), not a Flight Controller or ESC stack. A drone cannot function without a flight controller. Furthermore, the specification for the 'FC_Stack' has a null 'mounting_mm' value, making it impossible to verify if it would fit the 'Rekon7' frame, which itself is missing all mounting specifications.

ai_fix_suggestion.diagnosis: The component identified as 'FC_Stack' is actually an analog video transmitter (TS5823), not a flight controller. The build is missing its most critical component, the flight controller/ESC, making it fundamentally non-functional.
ai_fix_suggestion.strategy: Replace the incorrect video transmitter with a proper Flight Controller and ESC stack that is compatible with the other components. The new stack must support the 6S battery, handle the amperage from the 2807 motors, and fit the mounting pattern of a 7-inch frame.

replacements.reason: This query targets a component that provides the missing flight controller and ESC. It specifies the standard 30.5x30.5mm mounting for a 7-inch frame, 6S voltage compatibility for the selected battery, and a robust 55A rating suitable for large 2807 motors.

required_fasteners.usage: To mount the four motors to the frame arms.
To mount the FC/ESC stack to the frame body.
To secure propellers to the motor shafts.

blueprint_steps.title: Mount Motors to Frame Arms
blueprint_steps.details: Secure the four Emax ECO II 2807 motors to the ends of the Rekon7 frame arms. The motors have a 19x19mm bolt pattern, which is compatible with the frame's motor mounts. Ensure motor wires point inwards towards the center of the frame for wiring.

blueprint_steps.title: Install Flight Controller & ESC Stack
blueprint_steps.details: Mount the SoloGood F405 55A ESC and FC boards onto the frame's central mounting points using the 20x20mm holes. The Rekon7 frame supports this mounting pattern. Use standoffs between the boards and ensure the USB port is accessible.

blueprint_steps.title: Install Digital Camera and VTX
blueprint_steps.details: Mount the Digital FPV System camera between the frame's front camera plates. The Rekon7 frame is designed for 19-20mm cameras, which is standard for this type of digital system. Secure the video transmitter (VTX) unit in the rear section of the frame.

blueprint_steps.title: Attach Propellers (Final Step)
blueprint_steps.details: After full assembly, wiring, and software configuration, attach 7-inch propellers to the motors. Ensure correct propeller direction (CW/CCW) and tighten the prop nuts securely. THIS IS THE LAST STEP BEFORE FLIGHT.

blueprint_steps.title: Mount Battery for Flight
blueprint_steps.details: Use a battery strap (not listed in BOM) to secure the Zeee 6S 3300mAh LiPo battery to the top plate of the frame, ensuring an optimal center of gravity.
